intro: Baphia dewevrei var. kasaiensis, commonly known as the Kasai baphia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, arranged in racemose inflorescences, and it produces edible pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
